content: I see where you’re coming from, but I don’t think she’s worried about style points here. This is an emotional subject that has cost our country too much for too long. When people are upset they curse, they SCREAM. It’s understandable that some people are put off by swearing regardless of the context, but I would argue that her emotions are authentic. Even if you still disagree, please don’t let style take away from the main point of this piece. After all, “good” writing isn’t going to stop this madness. Anger that inspires substantive debate and produces functional policy changes can (will?).
